Learn how to set up Asp.net core project with Visual Studio Code

 

In this post, we will look at how you can get started with Asp.Net Core, build an amaizng site with Visual Studio Code

 

Setting Up Environment

 

Install .net Core 3.1 SDK from this website

download from https://dotnet.microsoft.com

Creating a new project

 

dotnet new -l

This creates the Asp.Net Core WebApplication(MVC)

dotnet new mvc

Installing extensions

Open a new project in Visual Studio Code Install several extensions that you might need for the project  C# / C# Extensions / C# FixFormat / C# XML Document  .NET Core Extension / .NET Core Tools  NuGet Package Manager

Testing the first app

dotnet build

dotnet run

 

Running MySql for the Asp.Net Core

Install a package

https://github.com/PomeloFoundation/Pomelo.EntityFrameworkCore.MySql

npm i Pomelo.EntityFrameworkCore.MySql

npm i Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Tools.DotNet

Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design

 

Adding the Package Manager Console

 dotnet tool install --global dotnet-ef https://stackoverflow.com/questions/57066856/dotnet-ef-not-found-in-net-core-3 https://stackoverflow.com/questions/41536603/visual-studio-code-entity-framework-core-add-migration-not-recognized

 dotnet ef migrations add first  dotnet ef database update

Issue

.Net Core MVC Page not Refreshing After Changes

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/53639969/net-core-mvc-page-not-refreshing-after-changes/57637903#57637903

 Add Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.RuntimeCompilation NuGet package to the project  Add the following in Startup.cs    services.AddControlloersWithViews().AddRazorRuntimeCompilation();
